metadata.Title: CVE-2016-20012 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - negligible
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED ** OpenSSH through 8.7 allows remote attackers, who have asuspicion that a certain combination of username and public key is known toan SSH server, to test whether this suspicion is correct. This occursbecause a challenge is sent only when that combination could be valid for alogin session. NOTE: the vendor does not recognize user enumeration as avulnerability for this product.

criterions.comment: openssh: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
openssh-ssh1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
